For example, the absolute value of 3 is 3, and the absolute value of 3 is also 3. The absolute value of a number may be thought of as itsdistancefrom zero.

Generalisations of the absolute value for real numbers occur in a wide variety of mathematical settings. For example, an absolute value is also defined for thecomplex numbers, thequaternions,ordered rings,Field (mathematics)fieldsandvector spaces. The absolute value is closely related to the notions ofmagnitude (mathematics)magnitude,distance, andNorm (mathematics)normin various mathematical and physical contexts.
